  - The red arch piece appears to be block #2
  - The orange roof pieces appear to be blocks #10, #11, #13, #14, #15, or #16 (need to determine the exact ones)

- Yellow middle: Block #6 (yellow horizontal rectangular block)

content.text:
# Analysis of Main Target Image

The image shows two separate structures:

## Structure 1 (Left): Red Cube with Hole
- Count: 2 blocks
- Layers: 2 layers
- Description: A red cube with a circular hole passing through it. It consists of two identical red blocks with semi-circular cutouts stacked on top of each other.

## Structure 2 (Right): House Structure
- Count: 5 blocks
- Layers: 3 layers
- Description: A house-like structure with:
  - Base layer: Blue rectangular block
  - Middle layer: Yellow rectangular block placed horizontally
  - Top layer: Red arch block (forming a doorway/tunnel) with two orange triangular pieces forming a roof

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

For Structure 1 (Left):
- 2× Block #2 (Red arch pieces stacked to form a complete circular hole)

For Structure 2 (Right):
- 1× Block #5 (Blue rectangular block) for the base
- 1× Block #6 (Yellow horizontal rectangular block) for the middle section
- 1× Block #2 (Red arch piece) for the top house section
- 1× Block #13 (Orange triangular piece) for one side of the roof
- 1× Block #14 (Orange triangular piece) for the other side of the roof

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 2
  Step2: Move block with index 2
  Step3: Move block with index 5
  Step4: Move block with index 6
  Step5: Move block with index 2
  Step6: Move block with index 13
  Step7: Move block with index 14
}
```

The assembly order places the left structure (red cube with hole) first, followed by the house structure from bottom to top.
